Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Associate Editor of "Applied Mathematics and Computation"

Hamel A (Leading Editor), Heyde F, Löhne A, Rudloff B, Schrage C (2015). Set Optimization and Applications - The State of the Art . SPRINGER PROCEEDINGS IN MATHEMATICS & STATISTICS, vol. 151, Springer-Verlag, ISSN: 2194-1009

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Co{organizer (with C. Tammer) of 2nd International Summer School "Optimal Control and Optimization Theory," Halle, Germany, 2002, with financial support of LEUCOREA and Federal State Sachsen-Anhalt

Co-organizer (with R. Henrion, W. Romisch) of the Workshop "Risikoma e und Anwendungen (Risk measures and applications)," jointly organized by Humboldt-University Berlin,Weierstrass-Institute Berlin and Martin-Luther-University Halle-Wittenberg, Berlin, 2003
Co-organizer of Minisymposium (2 sessions, with G. Eichfelder, A. Lohne) "Vector- and Set-Valued Optimization", SIAM Conference on Optimization, Boston 2008
Invited talk "A duality theory for set-valued risk measures" at NSF/CBMS Regional Conference on Convex Duality Methods in Mathematical Finance, UCSB, June 2008
Presentation at 7th EUROPT Workshop "Advances in Continuous Optimization", June 2009
Invited talk "The fundamental duality formula in set-valued optimization", University of South Australia, Adelaide, August 2010
AMS Joint Meeting, in stream "Set-valued optimization and variational inequalities", New Orleans, January 2011
Co-organizer "AMS Special Session on Set-Valued Optimization and Variational Problems" at the joint Annual Mathematical Meetings, New Orleans, January 2011 (with A. Khan, M. Sama)
Co-organizer of Minisymposium (3 sessions, with G. Eichfelder, A. Khan) 'Vector- and Set-Valued Optimization," SIAM Conference on Optimization, Darmstadt 2011
Talk at conference "Optimization, Theory, Algorithms and Applications in Economics", Barcelona, Spain, October 2011
Talk at conference "Mathematical Finance and Partial Differential Equations", Rutgers University, November 2011
Invited seminar talk "The complete-lattice approach to set-valued optimization: Solution concepts, duality, optimality conditions, applications", Technion Haifa, January 2012
Co-organizer "AMS Special Session on Set-Valued Optimization and Variational Problems" at the joint Annual Mathematical Meetings, Boston, January 2012 (with A. Khan, M. Sama)
Organizer of the International Summer School on Variational Analysis for Finance and Economics, Yeshiva University, New York, August 2012
Co-organizer of Conference "Set Optimization Meets Finance," Lutherstadt-Wittenberg, Germany, August 2012 (with A. Lohne, F. Heyde, R. Rudloff , C. Schrage)
Invited session "Set-Valued Convex and Quasiconvex Duality" at International Symposium of Mathematical Programming, Berlin, Germany, August 2012 (3 talks)
Invited talk "Set-valued optimization and conlinear structures: Theory, ramifications and challenges", South Pacific Optimization Meeting, Newcastle, Australia, February 2013
Invited workshop (2 lectures) "Markets with Frictions: From Set-Valued Risk Measures to Utility Maximization", University Hannover, November 2013
Invited seminar talk "Set Optimization -A New Mathematical Area with Applications in Finance", University of Technology Cottbus, Department of Mathematics, December 2013
Talk at 6th German-Polish Conference on Optimization "Set-Valued Optimization and Convex Process Duality", Lutherstadt-Wittenberg, February 2014
Co-organizer of Conference "Set Optimization Meets Finance," Brunico-Bruneck, Italy, September 2014 (with A. Lohne, F. Heyde, R. Rudloff , C. Schrage)
Invited seminar talk "Set Optimization and Applications in Finance -a New Mathematical Challenge", University of Trento, Department of Mathematics, October 2014
Two invited lectures at 9th Bachelier Colloquium, Metabief, France, January 2015
Invited talk at South Pacific Optimization Meeting, Adelaide, Australia, February 2015
Invited talk "Set-valued approaches to multi-utility representation and optimization" ZIF Bielefeld, June 2015
Invited talk "A set-valued approach to zero-sum matrix games with vector payoffs" at RIMS, Varese, Italy, September 2015
Co-organizer of "Bozen-Bolzano Risk School," Bozen, Italy, September 2015 (with F. Durante)

Invited talk "Stochastic orders, multi-utility representations and central regions. A set optimization perspective." Institute for Statistics and Mathematics, University of Business and Economics (WU), Vienna, October 2015

Invited session "Set Optimization and Applications" & invited talk "An abstract convexity approach to set relations and set optimization" at The 5th Asian Conference on Nonlinear Analysis and Optimization, Niigata, August 2016

Organizer of the invited session "Set Optimization: Advances and Applications" and presentation on "The fundamental duality formula in set optimization" at The 5th International Conference on Continuous Optimization of the Mathematical Optimization Society, Tokio, August 2016
Co-organizer of conference "Set Optimization for Applications", Vienna September 19-23, 2016, see http://sofa2016.wu.ac.at

Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Designed course “Convex Analysis for Finance and Economics,” the first version of which was run at Halle University in 2003, and the full course became part of the Ph.D. program at the Department of Operations Research and Financial Engineering at Princeton University (later also taught by B. Rudloff, P. Cheridito at Princeton University and M. Kupper at Humboldt University Berlin). Two times (2008, 2009) elected for "Princeton Engineering Commendation List for Outstanding Teaching."

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: Research Grant of German Academic Exchange Service (DAAD) for a Research stay at the Imperial College, London

Grant for a teaching project "Development and Test of a New Methodology for Multimedia Lectures for Graduate Courses in Mathematics" (with C. Filipski), supported by Federal State Sachsen-Anhalt, Germany, and EU Commission
Research grant for one year research stay at the IMPA, Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Cient ifico e Tecnol ogico (CNPq), Brazil
Member of the American Mathematical Society AMS

Grant for the project "An abstract convexity approach to scalarization in set/vector optimization and to multi-utility representation" (members of the Team: C. Crespi, F. Flores-Bazan, M.Rocca, C. Schrage) 22.500 Free University of Bozen Central Research Funds

Partecipazione al collegio dei docenti o.content: Member of the Collegio dei Docenti of the PhD program "Management and Economics on Organizational and Institutional Outliers" Faculty of Economics and Management, Free University of Bozen Cycle 2014
Member of the Collegio dei Docenti of the PhD program "Methods and Models for Economic Decisions", Dipartimento di Economia dell’Università dell’Insubria, Cycle 2015
Member of the Collegio dei Docenti of the PhD program "Methods and Models for Economic Decisions", Dipartimento di Economia dell’Università dell’Insubria, Cycle 2016

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Research Stay as PostDoc at Imperial College London, Department of Electrical Engineering
Research Stay as PostDoc/Lecturer at IMPA, Rio de Janeiro, Brasil

Associate Researcher/Lecturer at Department of Operations Research and Financial Engineering (ORFE), Princeton University, NJ, USA; teaching duties within the PhD program as well as undergraduate courses; research in mathematical finance

2010-13 Associate Professor for Mathematics, Yeshiva University New York (teaching courses in mathematics, probability, finance, mathematical economics and research work); 2014: offer for tenured full professor position at YU (declined)

Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: Co-PhD-supervisor of Andreas Loehne: He obtained his PhD in 2005 with thesis "Optimization with set relations" at University Halle– Wittenberg, summa cum laude
PhD supervisor for Carola Schrage: She obtained a PhD in 2009 with thesis "Set-valued convex analysis" at University Halle–Wittenberg, magna cum laude
Currently: PhD supervisor for Daniel Kostner at Free University Bozen, topic "Quantiles and Risk Measures for Multivariate Positions," ongoing

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: Leader of the project "An abstract convexity approach to scalarization in set/vector optimization and to multi-utility representation" (members of the Team: C. Crespi, F. Flores-Bazan, M.Rocca, C. Schrage)

Responsabilita' scientifica per progetti.content: Responsible for the project "An abstract convexity approach to scalarization in set/vector optimization and to multi-utility representation" (members of the Team: C. Crespi, F. Flores-Bazan, M.Rocca, C. Schrage), 22.500 Euro, Free University of Bozen Central Research Funds
